channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report I-2024080073
item.description:
Report I-2024080073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: FORT LAUDERDALA
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer in 36F Approached the aft lav and informed us that his cell phone charging unit battery"had expanded and broke out of the case". I asked him to bring it to us while I retrieved the TCB. He brought it to the cdt galley where FA Vanak took pictures and went to the front to share them with the purser and captain. I placed the unit temporarily in the TCB without breaking the seal awaiting further instructions and checking the eFAOM. The unit was not hot or Ieaking. The Captain looked at the pictures and advised us to place in the TCB and monitor. I did so for the remaining 40 mins or so. We returned the battery to the passenger upon deplaning and advised him to dispose of it properly. We were advised by MX that since we did not need to break the seal on the zipper Of the TCB it could be returned to its stowed position.

item.title: Report X-2024080879
item.description:
Report X-2024080879

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WENT TO A SPILL CALL ON TURQUOISE BELT SPOT 107. THERE WAS A PACAKAGE ON THE FLOOR RIGHTSIDE UP WITH DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS CORROSIVE AND OXIDIZER 5.1. THE PACKAGE HAD SHIPPING PAPERS. THE PACKAGE WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2024080045
item.description:
Report I-2024080045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-28
  • City: Medford
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OAK HARBOR FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading an IBC, the body was pushed against an electrical strut which punctured the IBC. Medford fire was called, after responding they evaluated the situation and left shortly after. A 3rd party clean up crew was brought in for clean up and disposal. ACT environmental suggested that our employees evacuate the building until the area was safe.
